intro: Asterochlaena sidifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf asterochlaena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, which bloom in the spring. Asterochlaena sidifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
